text: <@U22PKFRU5> to add a bit more context here.  Originally I updated the boilerplate css span6 targets to 50% width and removed the left margin.  <@ULHEDPDJ5> was nervous that this might effect other areas of the site, so we reverted these changes.    Currently to get the two columns full width, and remove the padding I'm overriding the CSS in the additional settings of each page.

This is a screenshot showing how we are overriding the CSS in the Header HTML of the homepage.    So I think what we are looking for is a way to apply these width's and zero out the margin by clicking a checkbox, or toggle switch... I like fancy toggle switches.

I may be wrong but looks to me like the source examples for crm_objects and crm_object are ending incorrectly (also copy incorrectly) in the HubL reference.
Note: Image below shows double ) on second and missing ) on first source example.
i may be just missing something obvious, but how can I access a modules Default content in hubl html?
Yep, this is a bug. Thanks for reporting!
